verses.verse: (A Song, a Psalm of Asaph.) O God, <S%H430><s%> do not remain quiet; <S%H1824><s%> Do not be silent <S%H2790><s%> and, O God, <S%H410><s%> do not be still. <S%H8252><s%>
For, behold, <S%H2009><s%> Thine enemies <S%H340><s%> make <S%H1993><s%> an uproar; <S%H1993><s%> And those who hate <S%H8130><s%> Thee have exalted <S%H5375><s%> themselves. <S%H7218><s%>

They make <S%H6191><s%> shrewd <S%H6191><s%> plans <S%H5475><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> Thy people, <S%H5971><s%> And conspire <S%H3289><s%> together against <S%H5921><s%> Thy treasured <S%H6845><s%> ones.

They have said, <S%H559><s%> "Come, <S%H1980><s%> and let us wipe <S%H3582><s%> them out as a nation, <S%H1471><s%> That the name <S%H8034><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> be remembered <S%H2142><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> more. <S%H5750><s%>"
For they have conspired <S%H3289><s%> together <S%H9191><s%> with one mind; <S%H3820><s%> Against <S%H5921><s%> Thee do they make <S%H3772><s%> a covenant: <S%H1285><s%>
The tents <S%H168><s%> of Edom <S%H9000><s%> and the Ishmaelites; <S%H3459><s%> Moab, <S%H4124><s%> and the Hagrites; <S%H1905><s%>
Gebal, <S%H1381><s%> and Ammon, <S%H5983><s%> and Amalek; <S%H6002><s%> Philistia <S%H6429><s%> with the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Tyre; <S%H6865><s%>

Assyria <S%H804><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> has joined <S%H3867><s%> with them; They have <S%H1961><s%> become <S%H1961><s%> a help <S%H2220><s%> to the children <S%H1121><s%> of Lot. <S%H3876><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
Deal <S%H6213><s%> with them as with Midian, <S%H4080><s%> As with Sisera <S%H5516><s%> [and] Jabin, <S%H2985><s%> at the torrent <S%H5158><s%> of Kishon, <S%H7028><s%>
Who were destroyed <S%H8045><s%> at En-dor, Who became <S%H1961><s%> as dung <S%H1828><s%> for the ground. <S%H127><s%>
Make <S%H7896><s%> their nobles <S%H5081><s%> like Oreb <S%H6159><s%> and Zeeb, <S%H2062><s%> And all <S%H3605><s%> their princes <S%H5257><s%> like Zebah <S%H2078><s%> and Zalmunna, <S%H6759><s%>
Who <S%H834><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Let us possess <S%H3423><s%> for ourselves The pastures <S%H4999><s%> of God. <S%H430><s%>"
O my God, <S%H430><s%> make <S%H7896><s%> them like the whirling <S%H1534><s%> dust; <S%H1534><s%> Like chaff <S%H7179><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the wind. <S%H7307><s%>
Like fire <S%H784><s%> that burns <S%H1197><s%> the forest, <S%H9194><s%> And like a flame <S%H3852><s%> that sets <S%H3857><s%> the mountains <S%H2022><s%> on fire, <S%H3857><s%>
So <S%H3651><s%> pursue <S%H7291><s%> them with Thy tempest, <S%H5591><s%> And terrify <S%H926><s%> them with Thy storm. <S%H5492><s%>
Fill <S%H4390><s%> their faces <S%H6440><s%> with dishonor, <S%H7036><s%> That they may seek <S%H1245><s%> Thy name, <S%H8034><s%> O Lord. <S%H3068><s%>
Let them be ashamed <S%H954><s%> and dismayed <S%H926><s%> forever; <S%H5703><s%> And let them be humiliated <S%H2659><s%> and perish,

That they may know <S%H3045><s%> that Thou alone, <S%H905><s%> whose name <S%H8034><s%> is the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> Art the Most <S%H9411><s%> High <S%H9411><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the earth. <S%H776><s%>
